name: HospiceCare
title: Hospice Care
purpose: (Clinical Focus: This set of CPT and SNOMED codes is intended to capture that a patient is ordered, admitted to, or referred to or hospice care.),(Data Element Scope: The intent of this data element is to identify patients who are ordered, admitted to, or referred to or hospice care.),(Inclusion Criteria: CPT and SNOMED codes associated with hospice care are included in the value set.),(Exclusion Criteria: CPT and SNOMED codes not associated with hospice care are excluded from this value set.)

contains.display: Supervision of a hospice patient (patient not present) requiring complex and multidisciplinary care modalities involving regular development and/or revision of care plans by that individual, review of subsequent reports of patient status, review of related laboratory and other studies, communication (including telephone calls) for purposes of assessment or care decisions with health care professional(s), family member(s), surrogate decision maker(s) (eg, legal guardian) and/or key caregiver(s) involved in patient's care, integration of new information into the medical treatment plan and/or adjustment of medical therapy, within a calendar month
Shared care - hospice and general practitioner (finding)
Transition from acute care to hospice (finding)
Transition from home-health care to hospice (finding)
Transition from long-term care to hospice (finding)
Transition from hospice to long-term care (finding)

Supervision of a hospice patient (patient not present) requiring complex and multidisciplinary care modalities involving regular development and/or revision of care plans by that individual, review of subsequent reports of patient status, review of related laboratory and other studies, communication (including telephone calls) for purposes of assessment or care decisions with health care professional(s), family member(s), surrogate decision maker(s) (eg, legal guardian) and/or key caregiver(s) involved in patient's care, integration of new information into the medical treatment plan and/or adjustment of medical therapy, within a calendar month; 15-29 minutes

Supervision of a hospice patient (patient not present) requiring complex and multidisciplinary care modalities involving regular development and/or revision of care plans by that individual, review of subsequent reports of patient status, review of related laboratory and other studies, communication (including telephone calls) for purposes of assessment or care decisions with health care professional(s), family member(s), surrogate decision maker(s) (eg, legal guardian) and/or key caregiver(s) involved in patient's care, integration of new information into the medical treatment plan and/or adjustment of medical therapy, within a calendar month; 30 minutes or more
